title: Sarah Bloom Raskin Withdraws as Biden's Pick for Top Banking Regulator; The move comes a day after Sen. Joe Manchin said he couldn't support Ms. Raskin's nomination, citing her views on climate change.
text:
Mr. Biden in January nominated Ms. Raskin to be the Federal Reserve's vice chairwoman of banking supervision, which plays a key role supervising the largest U.S. financial firms including J.P. Morgan Chase & Co., Bank of America Corp. and Citigroup Inc.

For weeks, Ms. Raskin's nomination has been stuck in the Senate Banking Committee after Republican lawmakers opposing her refused to attend a crucial committee vote. That deprived Democrats of a quorum needed to advance her to the full Senate along with President Biden's four other Fed picksâ€”including Chairman Jerome Powell, who has been nominated for a second term leading the central bank.

Her withdrawal could end that impasse.

(More to Come)

Sarah Bloom Raskin Withdraws as Biden's Pick for Top Banking Regulator
